basics.name: Philippe CARLE
basics.label: Web Developer
basics.summary:
Hi! 
I'm a French web developer. I've been working as a Lead Developer on advanced web apps & APIs in PHP using mainly the Symfony Framework in a small successful startup and an international industrial group for the past 6 years. 
I always advocate in my teams for best practices compliance as well as I keep in mind business' needs and features-delivery expectations üöÄ. 
I'm comfortable with frontend tooling as well (webpack, npm, yarn, sass, less...) and I'm currently learning ReactJS. Linux Systems administration is far from being another world to me. 
I'm very interested by the Go language and I am using it intensively in my personal projects.

work.summary: Management and development of web applications for the group with an international team. Support for progressive migration of all the legacy codebase (~800K LOC) to Symfony and continuous delivery of new features. Team management, code reviews, prioritization of tasks, specifications, external providers communication.
highlights: Testing, CI, automated deployment, Best Practices
Symfony encapsulation of a legacy system
Progressive migration of a big procedural codebase

work.summary: Development of several versions of the services and purchasing platform for 750 french pharmacies, technical direction for several side projects, R&D, maintenance and optimization, management of the team. Development of a REST API exposing data resulting from live and complex calculations related to sales of pharmacist (~700M records). Refactoring of all systems to a service-oriented architecture in 2015. Implementation of a centralized authentication system based on advanced JWT auth trading through the SOA architecture. Products built during those years allowed the company to raise 7M‚Ç¨.
highlights: Management and coaching of 9 frontend & backend developers

work.summary: Management of the company, web development and graphic design on behalf of various companies (including Apodis Pharma) and public administrations.
highlights: Commercial and technical relations with customers

work.summary: Teacher in graphic design and web technologies for the University and for the Notre-Dame La Riche Institute (~500h per year).

Involved in many of the administrative and communication-related processes inside the theater, from fine analysis of audience until mass-mailing, including comedians welcoming, openers hiring and ticketing systems management

volunteer.position: Local presidency, National Bureau and National Secretariat
highlights: Management of a national association with ~15000 members
Esoteric and philosophical research, personal development

volunteer.summary: Accompaniment of isolated people, picking them up by car and taking care of them, giving importance to their personal stories during a communal dinner.
highlights: Missing the traditional family Christmas Eve for those in need

courses: One-day workshop with William Kennedy (Managing partner at Ardan Labs)

education.studyType: Golang, Learn how to code by Todd McLeod
courses: Learn how to code by Todd McLeod
Coaching and reviews of TLD Developments

references.name: Martin Degenne - TLD
references.reference:
After working in his team for almost 2 years, I can say without a doubt that Philippe Carle is an excellent Lead Developer. 
During those two years, I spent at least an hour every week with him to follow my projects and find ways to deal with complex problems like optimization. He found time to teach me more about php and routing when I was struggling to understand parts of our technological stack and to listen to me when I had a different opinion about the best way to develop a solution. 
I know he was doing the same thing for everyone on the team but still never missed a meeting nor an important deadline despite the complicated and often tough environment. 
The team grew stronger thanks to him and I will happily work with him in the future if the opportunity presents itself.
